title: ~|cryptogirl.bd|~
author: ~|cryptogirl.bd|~
content: Why are the prices of graphics card and processor  and the others equipment suddenly skyrocketing?  The price of the graphics card which was 200 dollars in 2019 is now more than 300 dollars.  What is the real reason for these ,is it mining?

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: ~|cryptogirl.bd|~ on September 02, 2022, 02:26:56 PMWhy are the prices of graphics card and processor  and the others equipment suddenly skyrocketing?  The price of the graphics card which was 200 dollars in 2019 is now more than 300 dollars.  What is the real reason for these ,is it mining?this not belong in btc mining section.it belongs in the alt coin section.mods will move it soon.your question is a bit out of date.2019 gpus cheap and mining was bad2020 gpus went up a bit mining was better2021 gpus sky rocket mining is great2022 gpus slowly drop in price mining is getting worseyour question should have been asked say spring-summer 2021

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: ~|cryptogirl.bd|~ on September 02, 2022, 02:26:56 PMWhat is the real reason for these ,is it mining?Not just mining, but generally the price of everything is on the increase. The cost of production of these GPU's which includes, the cost of acquiring their various components plus transportation, even electricity to mention a few has increased, so you don't expect the price it was a year ago to be the same price currently. You can blame general inflation.

comments.body: There must be a disturbance in the temporal continuum this week. I was asked to add x16rv2 to cpuminer-optwhich was done 2 years ago.

comments.author: StormHawk
comments.body: Where are you getting these high price per graphic cards? Which country are you from? Do visit aliexpress and check on prices, the are already down but still not far from MSRP, if the merge is complete by 12 or 13 of this month many miners will shut down because profit will be lesser and unbearable.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Prices are somewhat better and people can buy graphic cards cheaper,the first ones to go down dramatically in price are old generations like Gtx 10 series and Rx 400/500 series.If these go down in price chances are that even newer generations will somewhat follow although at a much lower scale.What this means is that in a couple of weeks from now everyone who would like to try to build a rig or jump in the mining train would have the possibility to do so no matter his financial situation,yes that is how much down in price will go those old generation cards.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Where have you been living for the past couple of years? We had Covid19 in early 2020 and due to that it distrupted alot of supply chains and increased money supply. Pretty much everything is much more expensive now.Houses, rent, cars, computer equipment like GPUs.Another reason why GPUs went up since 2019 is because mining was very profitable in 2020-2021 so all the miners bought them up. Hence why the pricing doesn't make sense. Whats worse is people paying $200 for an RX 470 which had an MSRP of $200 about 6 years ago.

comments.author: |MINER|
comments.body: Quote from: ~|cryptogirl.bd|~ on September 02, 2022, 02:26:56 PMWhy are the prices of graphics card and processor  and the others equipment suddenly skyrocketing?  The price of the graphics card which was 200 dollars in 2019 is now more than 300 dollars.  What is the real reason for these ,is it mining?If you look at the last of 2019 then Covid-19 became a pandemic All over the world has suffered for this and also if you looks at the starting of 2020 you will see that Bitcoin price is also rising on that time . So I think  Both are the reasons for the increase in the price of GPUs. And now it's became little cheaper than 2021 but I think it is also can be reason that where are  you living. Moreover, due to the Russia-Ukraine war, the prices of all goods are increasing all over the world.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: What GPU is that? Your retailer is probably trying to get more profits if they're offering you that price point unless your location is so remote nobody else sells any GPU other than them.Go look online, you'll see that the price is getting better as others have said. If the online price + tax + other cost is still cheaper than your local store, I'd say go for it.
